gurmukhi: AMnX dXo grgY jb nMdih qau auiT kY jmnw qt AwXo ] nwie ktY kir kY DuqIAw hir ko Aru dyvn Bog lgwXo ]
transliteration: Annya Dayo Gadgad Jab Nandah(i) Tau Outh(i) Kai Jamnaa Tat Aayo|| Naae Katai Kar(i) Kai Dhouteeaa Har(i) Kai Jamnaa Tat Aayo|| Naae Katai Kar(i) Kai Dhouteeaa Har(i) Ko Ar(u) Devan Bhog Lagadyo||
translation: When Nand presented the alms of corn to Garg, he, taking all, came to the banks of Yamuna in order to cook food; after taking bath, he offered food to gods and the Lord; while he was remembering the Lord, Krishna;

gurmukhi: Awie gey nMd lwl qbY kr so gih kY Apny muK pwXo ] ckRq hÍY gXo pyK qbY iqh AMnX sBY ien BIt gvwXo ]99]
transliteration: Ooe Gad Nand Laal Tabai Kar So Gadh Kai Apne Moukh Paayo|| Chakrat Havigado Pekh Tabai Tih Annya Sabhai In Bheet Gadaayo||99||
translation: The son of Nand reached there and taking the food from the hand of Garg, he ate it; the Brahmin, in wonder, began to see this and think that this boy with his touch had soiled his food.99.

gurmukhi: Pyir ibcwr krXo mn mY ieh qo nh bwlk pY hirjI hY ] mwns pMc BU Awqm ko imil kY iqn so krqw srjI hY ]
transliteration: Pher(i) Bichaar Daryo Man Mai Eh To Nah Baalak Pai Har(i)jihai|| Maanas Paanch Bhoo Aatam Ko Mil(i) Kai Tin So Kartaa Sarjihai||
translation: Then the Pundit though in his mind, how can he be a boy?, this is some illusion. The creator has created this world with the unison of the mind, five elements and the soul;

gurmukhi: Xwd krI mmqw ieh kwrn mD kO dUr krY krjI hY ] mUMd leI iqh kI miq XO pt sO qn FwNpq ijau drjI hY ]100]
transliteration: Yaad Karimamtaa Eh Kaaran Madh Kau Door Darai Karjihai|| Moondd Laitih Kimat(i) Yau Pat Sau Tan Dhaanpat Jio Darjihai||100
translation: I had been merely remembering Nand Lal and this will be my illusion; that Brahmin could not recognize and his intellect closed down just as the tailor covers the body with a cloth.100.

gurmukhi: nMd kumwr qiRbwr BXo jb qo mn bwmnY kRoD kirE hY ] mwq iKJI jsuDw hir ko gihkY aur Awpny lwie DirE hY ]
transliteration: Nand Koumaar Trihaar Bhayo Jab To Man Baamnai Krodh Kario Hai|| Maat Khijhijasudhaa Har(i) Ko Gadh-kai Ur Aapane Laae Dhario Hai||
translation: When the same thing happened thrice, the Brahmin’s mind was filled with rage; the mother Yashoda cried at such saying and she hugged Krishna to her bosom;

gurmukhi: bol auTy Bgvwn qbY ieh doSn hY muih Xwid kirE hY ] pMfq jwn leI mn mY auT kY iqh ky qb pwie pirE hY ]101]
transliteration: Bol Outhe Bhagvaan Tabai Eh Doshan Hai Muhe Yaadh Kario Hai|| Pandat Jaan Laiman Outh Kai Tih Ke Tab Paae Pario Hai||101||
translation: Then Krishna said that he was not to be blamed for this, this Brahmin is only to be blamed. He remembered me thrice for eating food and I have gone there; hearing this, the Brahmin realised in his mind and getting up, he touched the feet of Krishna.101.

gurmukhi: nMd dwn qw kO dXo kh lau kho sunwie ] grg Awpny Gir clXo mhwN pRmud mn pwie ]102]
transliteration: Nand Daan Taa Kau Dayo Kah Lau Kaho Sounaae|| Gadg Aapane Ghar(i) Chadyo Mahaan Pramud Man Paae||102||
translation: The charity given by Nand to the Brahmin cannot be described; with happy mind, Garg went to his home.102.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk gRMQy nwm krn brnnM ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Naatak Granthe Naam Karan Barnanan||
translation: End of the description of Naming ceremony in Bachittar Natak.

gurmukhi: bwlk rUp Dry hir jI plnw pr JUlq hY qb kYsy ] mwq lfwvq hY iqh kO AO Julwvq hY kir mo ihq kYsy ]
transliteration: Baalak Roop Ddare Har(i) Jipalnaa Par Jhdolat Hai Tab Kaise|| Maat Ladaavat Hai Tih Kau Au Jhulaavat Hai Kar(i) Mo Hit Kaise||
translation: Krishna is swinging in the cradle in the form of a boy and his mother is oscillating him with affection;

gurmukhi: qw Cib kI aupmw Aiq hI kib sXwm khI muK qy Puin AYsy ] BUim duKI mn mY Aiq hI jnu pwlq hY irp dÍY qn jYsy ]103]
transliteration: Taa Chhah(i) Kioupmaa At(i) Hikahi Syaam Kahimoukh Te Phoun(i) Aise|| Bhoom(i) Doukhiman Mai At(i) Hijan(u) Paalat Hai Rip Dai Tan Jaise||103||
translation: The poet has described the simile of this beautiful scene in this way, just as the earth sustains both friends and foes equally, in the same way, the mother Yashoda, knowing fully well the possibilities of the difficulties in bringing up Krishna, is susta
